alert.note: Alert for Bennington; Western Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 3:23PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Bennington and northwestern Windham Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 321 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Stratton, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 30 mph and up to half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stratton, Pikes Falls, Stratton Valley, Winhall Station, Bondville, French Hollow, Stratton Acres, Rawsonville, Intervale, South Londonderry, Strattonwald, Stratton Mountain, Landgrove Town Center, Piper Ridge, Stocker Acres and West Jamaica. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized poor drainage flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
